Name: Jar
Description: Coarse pottery vase with rounded base, and wide neck and body. The vessel was found in one of the fourth millennium BC graves at the key early settlement near Kom el-Ahmar (the Hierakonpolis of later texts) in southern Upper Egypt. The rich tomb had white plastered walls and a roof of matting over a wooden frame. This and the other items of pottery date the burial to the last years of the process of state formation, when the culture of Upper Egypt extended over Lower Egypt, under a single kingship.
